scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "PVWfPpIBKcqa7QfWiG73", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Tamil Nadu"], "schemeShortTitle": "AGMA", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Education & Learning"], "schemeName": "Annal Gandhi Memorial Award", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "agma", "briefDescription": "The scheme provides financial assistance to one boy and one girl from the SC/ST community (Hindu Adi Dravidar) in each district who secure the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations.\n", "age": {"sc": {"gte": 17, "lte": 21}, "st": {"gte": 17, "lte": 21}}, "tags": ["Tribal Welfare", "Education", "Award", "Examination"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Annal Gandhi Memorial Award. It is also known as AGMA. The “Annal Gandhi Memorial Award”, introduced on May 7, 2012, by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to encourage academic excellence among students from the Hindu Adi Dravidar community. The scheme helps students pursue higher education through providing financial assistance.
<br>

<br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: In first year: ₹2,000/.  For the succeeding five years: ₹1,500/per annum.

Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
  The beneficiary should be a Student.
  The beneficiary should belong to the SC/ST (Hindu Adi Dravidar) community.
  The beneficiary must have secured the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations in their district. The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should collect the application form from the concerned educational institution.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the educational institution.
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.tn.gov.in/scheme/data_view/26775 Tags associated with the scheme include: Award, Education, Examination, Tribal Welfare.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Annal Gandhi Memorial Award.
It is also known as AGMA.

The “Annal Gandhi Memorial Award”, introduced on May 7, 2012, by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to encourage academic excellence among students from the Hindu Adi Dravidar community.
The scheme helps students pursue higher education through providing financial assistance.
<br> <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu.
Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.
The scheme provides the following benefits: In first year: ₹2,000/.
For the succeeding five years: ₹1,500/per annum.
Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
The beneficiary should be a Student.
The beneficiary should belong to the SC/ST (Hindu Adi Dravidar) community.
The beneficiary must have secured the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations in their district.
The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should collect the application form from the concerned educational institution.

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the educational institution.
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
tn.
gov.
in/scheme/data_view/26775 Tags associated with the scheme include: Award, Education, Examination, Tribal Welfare.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Annal Gandhi Memorial Award. It is also known as AGMA. The “Annal Gandhi Memorial Award”, introduced on May 7, 2012, by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to encourage academic excellence among students from the Hindu Adi Dravidar community. The beneficiary must have secured the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations in their district. The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should collect the application form from the concerned educational institution. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).

prompts.caption: How to apply: simple steps
prompts.ctu_text: The name of this welfare scheme is Annal Gandhi Memorial Award. It is also known as AGMA. The “Annal Gandhi Memorial Award”, introduced on May 7, 2012, by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, aims to encourage academic excellence among students from the Hindu Adi Dravidar community. The beneficiary must have secured the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations in their district. The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should collect the application form from the concerned educational institution. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).
